page.title: 12LIFE STYLES - PETWORTH RURAL
page.content: Everyone questioned takes regular holidays - one farmer and his wife having a foreign holiday every alternate year. Despite the stringency of farming work there is plenty of recreation available all the year. There are no Public Houses in the area - The Fox is now a private house. The nearest is at Kirdford. Social visiting is either with one's family or other farmers. There is a local Agricultural Association meeting at Petworth. At Gownfold the wife is a Committee member of Wisborough Green Women's Institute, and she and her husband are members of the Church Fellowship, meeting in private houses. The nearest church is at Kirdford, which the Gownfold family attend. At Marshall's farm the family go to the Young Farmers' Church at Ebernoe. Few of those interviewed go to any church.
